com.example.cardiobook

Class MainActivity.MyArrayAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.widget.BaseAdapter
      • android.widget.ArrayAdapter<BPs>
        • com.example.cardiobook.MainActivity.MyArrayAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.widget.Adapter, android.widget.Filterable, android.widget.ListAdapter, android.widget.SpinnerAdapter, android.widget.ThemedSpinnerAdapter
    Enclosing class:
    MainActivity

    public class MainActivity.MyArrayAdapter
extends android.widget.ArrayAdapter<BPs>

    MyArrayAdapter has been formally made like this to ensure that entries in the listview can have their background colours changed, depending on information given. Acknowledgements: https://medium.com/mindorks/custom-array-adapters-made-easy-b6c4930560dd, https://android--code.blogspot.com/2015/08/android-listview-text-color.html

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    kyle

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface android.widget.Adapter

        IGNORE_ITEM_VIEW_TYPE, NO_SELECTION

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyArrayAdapter(android.content.Context context, int res, java.util.ArrayList<BPs> list)
      When called, it makes mContext equal to the context, and BPList equal to list.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      android.view.View getView(int position, android.view.View convertView, android.view.ViewGroup parent)
      Used to ensure that the background colour of an entry is red when there's a blood pressure entry that isn't healthy/normal.

    • Method Detail

      • getView

        public android.view.View getView(int position,
                                 android.view.View convertView,
                                 android.view.ViewGroup parent)

        Used to ensure that the background colour of an entry is red when there's a blood pressure entry that isn't healthy/normal. Otherwise it'll be green.

        Specified by:
        getView in interface android.widget.Adapter
        Overrides:
        getView in class android.widget.ArrayAdapter<BPs>
        Parameters:
        position - Position in the arrayadapter list

        convertView -
        parent -
        Returns:
        row BP entry
